result.execSummary:
The defendant Shalonda S Davis-Lowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: BOTH COUNTS: Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED. Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

No contact with firearms.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim, No corporal punishment.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shalonda S Davis-Lowe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
3/2/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Amended Counts 1 and 2:   Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 4months in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

As to Count 2:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 4 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 1, .  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
- AODA and recommended treatment.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim, No corporal punishment.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Perform 25 hours of community service.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Defendant Shalonda S Davis-Lowe in court with attorney Scott Franklin Anderson.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Count 2:  Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Misdemeanor.

Defendant Shalonda S Davis-Lowe in court without counsel.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waited all morning in the gallery of the courtroom for defense counsel.  The clerk was advised by the Public Defender's Office that defense counsel was detained in multiple courts.  For the reasons as stated on the record, defendant moves for the appointment of new counsel.  Court granted the motion of defendant and ordered case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 38 on 8-11-2015 at 8:15 am.   Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse. 

OFF THE RECORD: Defense counsel appeared at 1:30 pm and was advised that new counsel will now be appointed to the case.  Clerk informed the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.    

All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld
